at.irian.ankor.switching.connector

Class ThreadLocalHandlerScopeContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.irian.ankor.switching.connector.ThreadLocalHandlerScopeContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandlerScopeContext

    public class ThreadLocalHandlerScopeContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements HandlerScopeContext
    HandlerScopeContext that uses a ThreadLocal for storing worker-local values. This implementation is meant for Switchboard implementations that use dedicated worker threads (e.g. based on ExecutorService). This implementation is not suitable for a Switchboards based on an actor system, because then the HandlerScopeContext should rather be based on the worker actor than the worker thread.
    See Also:
    SimpleHandlerScopeContext

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAttributes()
        Specified by:
        getAttributes in interface HandlerScopeContext
        Returns:
        a Map for storing worker-local data or helpers; handler implementors are encouraged to use unique keys for storing their values, so that different pluggable handlers won't have a name clash here
